item.title: AP Chemistry 2023 FRQ 1 Solution
item.description:
Chem CaFe https://chemcafe1234567.netlify.app/posts/20230708_apchemsolution/ -

AP Chemistry 2023 FRQ is available:

https://apcentral.collegeboard.org/media/pdf/ap23-frq-chemistry.pdf

AP Chemistry 2023 FRQ Q1 Solution:

(a)(i)

The complete electron configuration for an Mn atom in the ground state is 1s2 2s2 2p6 3s2 3p6 3d5 4s2 or [Ar] 3d5 4s2.

(a)(ii)

When manganese forms cations, electrons are lost from the 4s subshell.

(b)

Mn = 61.262 g - 60.169 g = 1.093 g

(c)

Cl = 62.673 g - 61.262 g = 1.411 g = 1.411 g * 1 mol / 35.45 g = 0.03980 mol

(d)

Mn:Cl = 0.0199 mol : 0.0398 mol = 1:2, so the empirical formula is MnCl2.

(e)

The number of moles of Cl calculated for this trial will be less than the number calculated in part (c), because the MnxCly that splatters out of the beaker will reduce the mass remains in the beaker as it is heated to dryness and thus reduce the amount calculated for Cl.

(f)(i)

The balanced net ionic equation for the reaction that has the greatest thermodynamic favorability is: 2MnO2(s) + Zn(s) -> Mn2O3(s) + ZnO(s).

(f)(ii)

E cell = 0.15 V - (-1.28 V) = 1.43 V

(f)(iii)

DeltaG = - nFE = - 2 * 96485.3321 s A/mol * 1.43 V * KJ / 1000 J = 276 KJ/mol

(f)(iv)

No, I do not agree with the studentâ€™s claim. While the anode loses mass, the cathode gains mass, and overall the mass is conserved; in addition, as long as the battery is well sealed, there won’t be loss of mass due to evaporation.

- https://chemcafe1234567.netlify.app/posts/20230708_apchemsolution/ -

item.title: AP Chemistry Exam Information
item.description:
Chem CaFe https://chemcafe1234567.netlify.app/posts/20230707_apchemexam/ -

AP Chemistry Exam

Exam Date

Mon, May 6, 2024 | 12 PM Local

Exam Format

The AP Chemistry Exam has consistent question types, weighting, and scoring guidelines every year, so you and your students know what to expect on exam day.

Starting with the 2023 exam, a scientific or graphing calculator is recommended for use on both sections of the exam.

Section I: Multiple Choice

60 Questions | 1 Hour 30 minutes | 50% of Exam Score

Questions are either discrete questions or question sets, in which students are provided with a stimulus or a set of data and a series of related questions.

Section II: Free Response

7 Questions | 1 Hour 45 Minutes | 50% of Exam Score

There are 3 long-answer and 4 short-answer questions. Long-answer questions are worth 10 points each; short-answer questions are worth 4 points each. The questions assess all 6 of the course skills: models and representations, question and method, representing data and phenomena, model analysis, mathematical routines, and argumentation.

AP Calculator Policy

Calculators are now allowed on both sections of the exam, starting with the 2023 exam, per the AP Exam Calculator Policy.

Make sure you and your students know what calculators are permitted.

- https://chemcafe1234567.netlify.app/posts/20230707_apchemexam/ -
